New Records: The Cleveland Guardians clinched their first AL playoff berth since 1948 with this victory.
Rookie Kyle Manzardo hit a home run in the first inning and went 3-for-4 in the game.
Key Match Events: Andrés Giménez hit a walk-off single in the 10th inning to score José Ramírez from second base, giving the Guardians a 3-2 win.
The game was decided in the bottom of the 10th inning after the Twins loaded the bases with one out but were unable to score.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland manager Stephen Vogt was praised for his leadership and described as 'one of the most special humans' by catcher Austin Hedges.
The Guardians overcame a 3-2 deficit in the 10th inning to secure the playoff berth.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians had the longest active World Series drought in baseball before this game.
Cleveland had sole possession of first place in the AL Central for all but one day over the past five months.
